originalText.text:
Only really offers part-time care, 8-2pm and take every holiday you can imagine so not really that useful for full-time work.

Also they're extremely difficult to get hold of we went through about 5 emails and 2 in person visits to get an answer on whether our application has been successful eventually finding out that they had prioritized a late application over ours. In fairness the person had another child in the daycare already but it was a bit frustrating not getting straight answers it felt like they really went above and beyond to prioritize the other family over ours.

originalText.text:
We've been with CLC for almost a year and are very happy with this day care. The daycare is very much involved in the children's care -- this isn't just a place to drop off and pick up kids. They encourage and sometimes also expect the parents to be involved -- from kids dance parties at school to preparing food and snacks and the usual parent/teacher conferences and parenting workshops.

The teachers are all very well experienced, nice and it was great to see my little one warm up to them very fast. The teachers-to-toddlers ratio is also very good, and the daycare itself is very spacious with multiple rooms with windows, and a private (and for New York relatively large) courtyard.

Overall, while tuition tends to be a bit more expensive than other comparable daycares, we have found it to be worth it.
